greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least positive integer m such that {A000720(k*n): k = 1, ..., m} contains a complete system of residues modulo n, or 0 if such a number m does not exist.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) is always positive. Moreover, a(n) <= 2*prime(n) for all n > 0.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100
Zhi-Wei Sun, On a^n+bn modulo m, preprint, arXiv:1312.1166 [math.NT], 2013-2014.
example: a(4) = 8 since {A000720(4*k): k = 1, ..., 8} = {2, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 9, 11} contains a complete system of residues modulo 4, but {pi(4*k}: k = 1, ..., 7} contains no integer congruent to 3 modulo 4.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Feb 10 2014
